had revealed it to another person with whom I didn't get along very well.
The loss of a very good friend.

I'm glad when I have good relations with my colleagues and most á
of all when we are at a party.

I experienced it once when we were on a drive. Our car passed by á
the one comming from the opposite direction at an incredibly á
small distance.

I get angry with people who attain certain status without á
deserving it, only with the support, authority and influence of á
other people.

I feel sad when I see things done against men and nothing could á
stop it - at least I think so.

I experienced it when I was accepted at the Medical Higher á
Institute.
I felt it when I sat for my exam in anatomy.

I experience that feeling when I am unsulted without deserving á
it or when someone deceives me.
When my grandfather died.
After each successfully passed exam I am happy.

A friend of mine gave birth to a child. Very dangerous delivery. á
I was afraid for her and for the baby.

I get angry when someone imputes on me things I never can do, á
naturally negative. Servility, "connections", impudence, traits á
that get me mad.

My brother is a soldier. He promised to come home in a furlough á
but in the last moment he phoned and said that he could not come.

After the term exams I happened to meet a person that I respect á
and of whom I think very highly. It was nice that although we see á
each other rarely he had not forgotten me.

Few years ago my father was very ill. He stayed at a hospital for á
a long time. Then I experienced that terrible feeling that I á
might lose him.

I have a friend that I deeply trusted but it happened that I lost á
my confidence in her for which she herself was to blame.

We are several friends but our characters are very different and á
we inevitably split in the two extremes. It is sad that I myself á
don't know what to do, I try not to hurt either of the "parties" á
because there are conflicts to which one I should belong.

I experienced this feeling when I was accepted as a student. á
Because everything turned out different from my expectations. á
Although I passed the exam successfully I was accepted as a á
student only when I didn't expect it at all, namely at the á
beginning of September.

In the real sense of the word I experienced fear in my first á
months in the army. During my first night of duty. The cause for á
all this was a bear. I became panic sticken (may be for the first á
time) and even forgot that I had a gun.

When I was a soldier I quarrelled with my commander and may be in á
revenge for this he detailed me on duty two successive nights. á
Naturally he checked me up on the second night and found me á
asleep for which he sent me to the cells.

Sometimes I experience sadness for the Sports High School and for á
my unrealized dreams in the sport. Anyway there I spent six years á
of my life.
Spontaneous picnic with sister and friend and children - great.
Can think of no time that I have felt fear.

Teenage neighbours smashed my letterbox for the fifth time in a á
couple of months. It was a deliberate action of kids who had á
stayed in my home, had meals there yet took a dislike to my á
daughter.
Guy I cared for went back to Canada to live.

Meeting with two of my friends I had not seen for 15 years. They á
were special people to me.

I was in the Korean War. We were attacked with mortars, me and á
companion. We stopped the jeep and ran for cover. Fortunately á
neither of us was hit but we both came close to being killed.

I've a situation of responsibility an employee who had a habit of á
being late, came late again after promising to say he would be at á
work in a few minutes, then arrived 3 hours later. He had been á
drinking.

My brother in law was dying of cancer. To see him wasting away á
was very sad.

When we took out an 84 year old woman for the evening and had á
hamburgers. She described the evening out as her happiest night á
out in 20 years.

While tramping on a narrow path two of us were confronted by a á
woman with two snarling dogs, demanding we get off the property - á
via a flooded river !

A friend got angry and drove "like a lunatic" with me and others á
in his car. I was angry about his dangerous driving.

A boy I look after for the probation service deliberately á
offended to provoke a reaction from the police.

I was seriously injured in a road accident. The very first steps á
I took with only one crutch to support me I felt so good. I enjoy á
being alive.

I was attacked, standing in a doorway, by a pack of 5 dogs, á
alsatians and farm dogs with my escape route blocked by a shut á
fence.

In the house where I live there is a new flatmate. His friends á
unfortunately are the dirt of society, intelligent, fashonable, á
rich and bored. At a party recently they were doing things I á
didn't like done in my house. I felt angry at them.

I was driving near my girlfriend's house and I decided to keep á
going because it was late and I would be back in the next few á
days anyway. The next day she was killed in a road accident.

When I found out that a set task (i.e. 2 essays and a test), the á
thought of which had oppressed me, were not on the date I had á
thought.
When confronted and in my opinion hassled by the police.

When, for example, I was in my eleventh school year and I learned á
I had been classed for the Bulgarian Language and Literature á
National Olympiad.

When, for example, my grandfather fell seriously ill. It was á
necessary for him to be operated and I felt great fear of losing á
him because he is so dear to me.

When, for example, I was not approved to continue my studies at á
the Moscow University, no matter that I had the highest marks and á
in general the best records of all the candidates.

When, for example, I left for the first time my parents and I á
went to live in Sofia.

Some time ago a close relative of mine got off cheap with the á
worst.
The last time I felt it was when I was coming home late at night.
I haven't often felt this feeling. Once someone stole my garment.
Recently I happened to remain alone for a long time.

Realizing one's desire, an experienced feeling of satisfaction á
from the realization of one's desires and aims.

Fear of the loss of a close friend, of feeling the ground slipping á
from under my feet.

Attitude to some manners of dealing and some "sanctioned" á
relations.

Feeling unable to preserve one's ideas and ambitions as innocent á
as they are when you are young.
I won a sport contest.
If a close relative's life is in danger.
A close person lied to me.
Getting separated from my girlfriend.
When my son was born.
Before an examination.
Unjust punishment of a friend of mine.
After the loss of a close relative.
Meeting a loved man.

I felt a physical fear, if I can call it this way, today, in the bus where á
I was sitting on the first seat. While turning the driver didn't á
see the tram which was making a dash towards us (coming from the á
side I was), and whose driver intended to cross in yellow á
light.

At an unjust, or to be more precise, at a bureaucratic treatment á
of one's personality.
When one is alone and knows that all the others are celebrating.

I sensed such a feeling when I understood I was admitted to the á
University. I was at home, the atmosphere was still, though I á
myself was full of suspense. I tried to do different things. When á
the telephone rang and...! Yes, of course there were other á
situations when I felt a similar feeling but I was unmindful of á
them.

This feeling I sensed quite recently. It was arisen by the á
terrific thought that I might lose the man I loved !

Anger I felt when my boyfriend told me he didn't mind breaking it á
off with me, i.e. each of us to take his own road. Because until á
that moment, he deliberately restricted our dates. The motives á
were brought to my knowledge later.

Sometimes, when I'm alone I am seized by this feeling. But it á
always helps me to come round and at the same time to judge if it á
is worth. Very often this feeling is caused to me by people - á
friends who I love and respect.
When I was admitted to the University.

I had to have my tonsils out. I had been making up my mind almost á
for a year - I was afraid. But during the two hours in the á
hospital room, while I was waiting to be called for the operation I á
felt a real fear - of the pain, of what they were going to do to á
me, of the unknown.

In a conversation my boyfriend expressed definite and quite á
pretentious opinions and he took up an attitude towards a theory á
which he himself had never known. His information was from á
fortuitous sources.

Summer, heavy rain, storm - I was standing with my face stick to á
the window: the childhood, something was going away forever this á
summer, I was leaving my home, I was going to study in another á
town, for the first time I was leaving my parents, friends, I had á
to manage myself, a long and loved period of my life was over - I á
was crying.
When I understood that I was admitted to the University.

I felt this feeling when one day my landlord's cat had crept á
under my bed and I couldn't cope with it during an hour and a á
half.

I feel this feeling when I am to fill in a questionnaire or a á
form.
When the man I loved decided to leave me forever.

A quarrel was followed by the decision of leaving a person close á
to me. Several days later my regret was great. I was beside á
myself. Quite unexpectedly he came and the conflict was calmly á
solved. I was glad at the possibility to be with him.

One evening I was watching the news on TV. Again they were á
talking about the danger of war. Suddenly I imagined what it á
might mean for me, for my friends, for the people close to me. I á
felt it a very near and possible event.

Unfair and unjust attitude toward a person close to me, what I á
was the witness of, caused anger in me.

The thought that I'll never sit at the school desk again, caused á
a deep grief at the end of my eleventh form.
When I understood I was admitted to the Sofia University.

I broke my knee when I was skiing over "Yastrebetz" (a racing á
track in a Bulgarian winter resort).

The doctors from Belogradchik town determined a wrong diagnosis á
to my son. A month later, after some complex examinations at ISUL á
(A medical institute in Sofia), the diagnosis was categorically rejected.

My son lives with my parents in the country and I feel this á
feeling always when leaving for Sofia, but the last time it was á
quite strong.

I am a sportwoman as well. I felt joy when after an year of á
practice, at a contest, I covered the norms for "a master of sports".

I felt fear once, when the car in which I travelled directed á
towards the precipice along the road.

When I see how people around me pass by certain unjustice because á
of indifference or cowardice.
When I left a man in whom I really believed.
When I was admitted to the University.
When I broke my leg I felt fear.
When someone lies to me.
At an unjust insult or injure.
When my affairs with the girl I love settled positively.

In a dam lake, when the water was let flow to water the plants á
and I and two other boys were near the water pit. We rescued á
ourselves only thanks to the flippers and the tyre that was with á
us.

It was quite recently, at the football match between the national á
teams of Bulgaria and France. I felt strong anger with the Scottish á
referee who ran the match quite partially.

When I am alone and listen to a song which I like very much and á
which I had listened before together with friends.

I passed successfully the preliminary exam for a participation in á
the children Assembly.

I was alone in my room at the boarding house when at 12 o'clock á
someone knocked violently on the door.

A friend of mine promised to come with me to the cinema but he á
didn't come.

I felt sadness when I remembered my former boyfriend with whom I á
got separated an year ago and when comparing him with my present á
one with whom things are not much of a success.
Bulgaria won a football match against France.
I was going to knock down a pedestrian with my car.
I was neglected undeservedly.
My grandmother died.
I felt joy when my two twin sisters were born.

The night before my wife had given birth to our twins. I felt á
fear in the hospital yard, I feared if everything was going to be á
in order.

About a month ago the Regional Council refused to pay my wife the á
due maternity benefit, because of bureaucratic reasons.

Some months ago my wife gave birth to twin sisters. She had no á
idea of looking after babies and she felt quite oppressed. The á
fact that I couldn't help her caused grief to me.

The period when I was pregnant and when I gave birth to my son. á
I can say those were the happiest months in my life.

A fear from the loss of a close friend as a result of his á
behavior.

When I encountered not only with my father's lack of á
understanding but also with his unwillingness to understand me as á
a parent, as far as things for which I (not he) have proves to be á
right are concerned.
From the fact that my husband and I are not in good terms.

I felt joy when I saw my daughter after a separation of twenty á
days.

I felt fear when I sat for one of my exams. Though my fear was á
not quite justifiable, I still remember about it.

I thought him a good friend but he tried to lie to me several times. á
Last time was the height of impudence. He promised he would come á
home but he didn't. I felt a sense of anger and insult.
A fear of lack of personal powers.

At an undeserved attitude toward a man, when human personality is á
not treated decently.
At an irrevocable loss (with respect to human relations).
When I was admitted to the University.

Because of a conflict with my parents there was a possibility to á
interrupt my studies.
I feel a strong anger when I am treated unjustly.
At a prolonged separation with my family.
The day when my son said for the first time "mummy".
Before an exam in logics.

My husband and I were invited at the house of our nieghbours then á
we got an invitation on the part of my parents which we had to á
refuse. A a result they called me by words that provoked my á
anger.

My son lives in the country. I feel sadness when I see mothers á
having walks with their children.

The sense of joy comes to me always after a period of depression, á
as an organic feeling for an upsurge. I don't exclude the á
situative feeling but in this case the reason is not in me, it's á
out of me.

I bet that I would jump down from a window. I was sure that I á
would jump but before I did it I rather felt fear.

A honest "sliding" on the part of a girlfriend of mine. á
Terribly crossed I started breaking things and tearing books.

Alone I am coming back home in the night after the serial á
"explanation".
My son was born.
I had a car accident.

I was drawn up a statement for an infringement of the traffic á
ordinance. In fact I was innocent.
I lost a close friend.

After 10 days of hard work and having suffered many changes I á
passed my last exam.
Before going to the dentist.

When I am made to do things in which I see no sense and I waste á
my time. Some time ago I had to participate in a sociological á
investigation and then I got really angry.

When I feel I must be with somebody, to talk with somebody - but á
I am alone.

When I am with friends and I do what pleases me this often á
happenes.

When I have to go in for an exam and the examinor is a person á
with a whimsical character and unsteady requirements.

I unfairly got a low mark on an exam and I failed to win a grant, á
since then I don't have much confidence in myself at an exam.
It happened that I was alone - with no contacts with friends.

I was happy when I understood that the girl I liked was in love á
with me.
I am afraid before an exam or colloquium.

I get angry when my smaller brother misbehaves and talks with indecent á
words.
When my dog was stolen.
When I met with friends that I hadn't seen for a long time.

One evening a friend of mine was telling a fearful story, nobody á
took it seriously but I got frightened.

I got angry with a stranger in a train who behaved impertinently á
and immorally
When I failed at the first entrance exam.

Six months ago when I got acquaintanced with a person whom I á
trusted infinitely and from whom I expected help and friendly á
feelings. With him I found much in common - in our views and in á
our fate.

Few days ago I really experienced fear. It was connected with á
unexpected actions on the part of a group of people. This evoked á
in me many negative emotions.

I always get angry when somebody deceives me, or tries to conceal á
his lie skilfully and this offends me even more.

Sadness - this is an emotion which I have felt very often á
recently. I can't remember a concrete example. I will describe my á
general impression from severl situations which evoked this á
feeling in me.
When I was accepted as a student.

I was a bit frightened when it was found that there was something á
wrong with my liver. However it turned out that it was not á
serious and I need not worry.

With the girl whom I may be loved truly. When she refused to come á
with me to an occasion (she was from another town).

For the girl who halped me go on living and made me happy - when á
I don't see her even for two or three days.

I felt it when on duty in the hospital I understood that I was á
not afraid to face death, that I also helped a little to relieve á
the pains of a patient.

Fear overwhelmed me when right against the car I was in I saw á
another one, as if out of control of the driver.

I felt it when a girl who was dear to me lied to my face. I got á
angry with the fact that she knew I didn't believe her but she á
kept on telling lies.
Sadness, no, I felt something much stronger when my father died.
When I knew that my husband and I were going to have a child.

Two years ago I saw a film on the TV. Even now it makes me á
afraid.
When my husband stays late at a meeting and I have to be alone.
The loss of a person I loved very much.

I was very happy when I got the message that I had been accepted á
as a student in medicine.

I felt something close to that when I saw that there was a man on á
the terrace of the flat.

I got angry when I learned how short a time we had to prepare for á
the term examinations.

I felt sad when my first boyfriend and I left each other. It was neither á
his fault nor mine.

When I learned that my parents were going abroad and leaving me á
alone for a few years.

I was at the seaside and my brother disappeared for a couple of á
hours.

When I was admitted to the Institute. I had problems with many á
people about my applying for this institute and I decided to á
prove that one can pass excellently without visiting any á
preparatory couse. That is - I proved what I could do on my own.

Once as a child I dreamed of a fire. Since that time I hadn't á
wanted to sleep in that bed and had feared the night darkness á
(and so it is now).

A chief was unjustly punished on an autumn brigade and the one á
who was really guilty kept silent. I stepped in front and told á
the truth. The guilty chief called me in after the roll-call and á
threatened me.

Years ago I fell in love for the first time. as natural for every á
school-girl I was day-dreaming. Later (after 3 years) we left á
each other. No one was to blame but I felt deep sadness. Even now á
I remember about it quite often.

When I learned I was admitted to study what I wanted most - á
floriculture (this is a narrow specialization from the general á
one).

I was walking on the pavement when a white car rolled on it and á
directed towards me. I was quite near the house wall when it á
rolled by and hit me.

My grandmother's brother had taken active part in the resistance á
movement. He had been in prison many times and there he lost his á
health. He became an invalid. When we phoned to First Aid the á
nurse on duty behaved quite unkindly when she understood how old á
he was (79).

My boyfriend is a soldier. He was on a leave. I felt sad when we á
had to get separated again.

I was very glad when I learned I was a student already. I heard á
about it over the phone, I didn't believe it at first.
I had worries about a certain illness.

I suffered from a gynaecological illness. I was quite displeased á
to hear that my roommates had talked about it and they had á
misrepresented the truth. I felt deeply hurt when I learned that á
it was done by a "good" acquaintance of mine.

When my first boyfriend left me. I tried not to let him á
understand I felt miserable.

I felt glad when I took the rather difficult organic chemistry á
examination.

This was what I felt when my boyfriend went to Bourgas to study á
there. I had the feeling I would lose him. Anyway the distance á
Plovdiv-Bourgas seemed to me so great.

I confronted with this feeling at the Institute quite recently, á
the pedology lecturer was the cause.

This feeling was quite deep when my friend (girl) died in a car á
accident.

I sensed a strong feeling of joy when in the plant, at my working á
place, I got a message that I was admitted as full time student at á
the Higher Agricultural Institute.

Fear when fulfilling my obligations on my first night fatigue á
duty as a soldier.

When on a car journey a fellow student crossed our way with his á
own car and we had to bump into a roadside trunk.
The loss of a close relative who was ill with cancer.

After a difficult exam. When I had not hoped to take it and had á
got a high mark. When you present someone with something and he á
feels glad.

Fear from the unknown. I felt fear when I sat for the entrance á
examinations.

I feel angry at people's indifference at our ability to be á
present at an event and to stay partial to what happens.

When you are far away from relatives and friends. I feel sad for á
my early years, for the freedom and the carefree years of á
childhood.

I was sitting for an exam in biochemistry, I was very excited á
because it was a supplementary examination. I passed the exam á
very well and was glad because I recovered my selfconfidence.

Students fear many things but we seem to fear the examinations á
most of all. I remember I was horror stricken before my á
microbiology exam, because it was a decisive one.

It was necessary to organise a competition in connection with a á
celebration. Everyone was to be present at that event. It turned á
out that there was no audience at all because everyone had á
pretended to be very intelligent and no one had come. I got á
furious.

When I part with my friends I feel always sad for some time. I á
can't remember a concrete example now. For example I have just á
parted with a friend of mine and I am feeling sad.

When I succeded in establishing a contact with a girl (who is now á
my girlfriend).
I fear before each exam.
When my bosom friend tried to lie to me.
When I quarrelled with a very close friend of mine.

I feel joy usually after each taken exam, the last one was in á
February.

It was not long ago when I and two of friends of mine got quite drunk á
and one of them began to rave under the influence of the alcohol. á
I felt fear of what could have happened.

I felt anger at my last exam, I felt angry with our teacher, á
because he did not rate me objectively and I failed.

I met a girl some time ago and I cared very much about her but it á
happened so that we left each other. I felt some sort of sadness, I think á
I can call it so.
When I was admitted to the Higher Institute.

I felt fear when I fell down and broke my leg into pieces and I á
could not feel it at all.

I felt angry when I failed in an exam about which I knew quite a á
few things and I did not deserve to be plucked.

When my mother and father were on an excursion in Chechoslovakia á
and I was at a student camp and I heard over the radio about the á
events that were taking place there.

I felt joy when I was admitted to the Higher Agricultural á
Institute.

I feel fear quite often but this feeling was very strong last á
year when my husband was quite unexpectedly sent to the hospital.

That was what I felt with a teacher who put down quite unreal á
marks.

I felt sad when a friend of mine died and I felt that something á
had irrevocably gone away from me.

I was for the first time on a brigade this year. At that time my á
sister was to bear a child. I was mad with joy when I opened the á
telegram from my parents and learned I had a nephew.

It was some years ago when one evening some people came home and á
told us my father was badly injured in an accident.

I faced this feeling when I realized I wasn't admitted to the á
institute in the first classifying, in spite of the high mark I á
had got at the entrance examination.á

Always when I get separated from my friends and relatives from my á
home town.

Naturally when I got myself discharged this was my second á
birthday.
When I failed my first exam at the Higher Institute.

A nuisance used to live in our flat a month ago. I experienced á
this feeling when I tried to chase her out.
After my father's death.

I felt the greatest burst of joy when after being heavily ill for á
a long period, my father came back home.

I was terrified during an axcursion in Italy. I was lost and left á
alone in this unfamiliar country.

I took part in a football match. The referee was extremely á
partial to the opposite team. This stirred up my discontent and á
anger.
When my first girlfriend an I left each other.

When I got a message that I was employed as a nurse at a á
kindergarten.
When I first sat for an entrance examination.

When a teacher though pretending to be a highly cultivated á
teacher and a man, slapped a classmate of mine in the face quite á
undeservedly.
When I got separated from my first love.

Being invited out by a person I wished to get closer to. He á
telephoned and invited me to go out with him the next night.
Watching a horror movie with friends.

The breakup of a relationship. After the event I was upset/sad á
then angry maybe 2/3 weeks later.

The funeral of a friend who was killed in a car accident. She was á
of my own age, there were many of my own friends present, as well á
as her family etc.

Achievement of a task by a friend who had begun a new job. She á
wasn't confident of handling the situation so was thinking  of á
leaving the job only after 2 days employment.

Walking home at night after university - part of the way, there á
are ano lights and I am walking down a thoroughfare with the á
thouth of no one hearing me if I have to scream.

When my son omits to carry out certain duties at home that he á
knows needs doing.

When I saw my niece (5 yrs) crying in the hallway for her mother á
who had passed away about a month ago.

Felt joy a few years ago when I was away on holiday. And sat very á
close to my best friend looking straight into the eyes.

I had to tell someone that I was interested in remaining celibate á
and alone. And that my spiritual master strictly prohibited á
sexual relations outside of marriage. This caused great fear á
through lack of conviction afraid to hurt someone's feelings á
despite my own being hurt in the process.

In a sociology class I felt very angry towards some members of á
society for exploiting the Polynesian people, dawn raids by á
Police (Martin Luther King, Blacks in S.A.). But this was just a á
reflection of my own shortcomings.

Felt sad about some street kids in QUEII square, Aotea square. á
Because they had been sniffing glue and some were very young. I á
went into the role of a performing clown.

When I meet old past pupils of mine - and find they are all doing á
well - I feel joy. Yesterday I met a young woman (20 yrs) I'd á
taught her at 6 yrs, then at 12 yrs and hadn't seen her for last á
3-4 yrs; she was no longer a waitress but a meter maid for á
Council.

A Maori language oral test, yeaterday - Although I had studied á
intensely - once in the examiners room "I blew it" -  I was so á
nervous I couldn't reply easily - It was very important, but I á
got only blankness.

A friend visited and made comments that my house/garden were not á
as neat/tidy as in the past. I'd not seen her a year - She á
implied I'd gone to the pack (I'd only been working full time, á
and taking 3 University exams part time).

When my father a 4th/5th generation colonial (from Eng.) attacked á
me verbally about my chosen partner. A man whom he discarded á
because his colour skin was not white. His ultimate disgust á
saddned me.
My 3 children - each top his class in the final exams 1984.

A truck (big one) nearly mowed me off the road (I was driving a á
small Lazer).

A shop in Downtown wouldn't accept my Visa Card - before December á
last year.

My dog of 16 and 1/2 years - "Lord Grey" died in his sleep - His á
death caused me more and deeper sadness than I thought.
When my daughter was born.

When my mother entered surgery for a quadruple heart bypass. I á
felt intense fear at the time she was actually wheeled away.

When my husband got picked up in our new car for drunken driving. á
We had made a pact the other would not drink and so therefore á
would be the driver for the evening etc. I was not present at the á
time.
When my grandmother died very suddenly without warning.

Being reunited with my family after not having seen them for 5 á
years, at the airport. Sheer elation at getting through the á
"paper work" collecting bags and the anticipation of coming á
through the customs gate.

I caught a huge eel on a fishing line which I had pulled into the á
boat. I cut the line and threw the whole lot back into the water. á
Later that day and about ten miles away I went swimming and á
someone made the comment wondering how far eels could swim, I á
abruptly ended swimming for fear at an unseen eel for a few days á
until we had left the district.

My partner without discussing with me the situation decided it á
was time for us to have a break and went ahead and arranged his á
own life for the next 6-12 months, then told me the day before it á
was about to happen having been tolerant and friendly for the á
preceding week.

I had been living in an overseas city and made the decision to á
leave the city and come home about 12 months before I met a whole á
new set of friends, leaving them at the airport was sad and á

Never really had the experience just yet - N/A.

(1) My father died. (2) My natural father contacted me a year á

noise. When I was studying I couldn't concentrate and got angry.

I partly colored my hair black. My mother didn't like it and á

It appeared that I gave correct answers to all questions during á

My father was very angry with me, and I locked me up in the á

My sister borrowed some LP records for a party. She had left them á

When my grandmother died, her life was heavy and her last hours á

Unofficially I was informed about my results of the final á

I am thinking about death, the eternal of it, the unknown, the á

If they force me to eat something I don't like. For example, my á

When the parents of my girlfriend gave permission to spend our á

When the relationship with my first girlfriend broke up and I á

When my last relation broke up.
When I passed the driving test (on the second try).

I was walking in the wood at night with my boyfriend. Very á

I am a teacher in arts and crafts (boys from 15-16 years). for á

My sister was in coma for 3 months (due to a train accident). Now á

When I started a relation with a girl, with whom I have fallen in á

Once sitting in the cinema, I became very anxious (watching a á

I work for a journal. Once the lay-out came to nothing, due to á

My mother was stuck by an apoplectic fit, was hemi-paralyzed and á

I felt very happy when I heard I had passed the examination to á

On a holiday in France I made a walk in the woods all alone and á

I invited two friends. We should go out together. Those two girls á

I felt very sad when my boyfriend wanted to break our á

I liked to see off my aunt (from Zaire) to the airport. That á

I went to the ballet lessons with a little friend in the dark. On á

I was sleeping nicely until in the middle of the night when I became á

My boyfriend with whom I had a longlasting relationship, fell in á

When I had to undergo the final examination of secondary school, á

When I had left my home, my father, under false pretences, got me á

When my father took away my cherised diaries to burn them (I was á

I felt very sad when I left home because I could not stand it any á

Passing my driver's examination (after two failures).

When I was six years old we were on holiday in France. There was á

A quarrel with my mother because I thought she said very á

The disease and subsequent death of a close acquaintance. Sadness á

When a friend of mine had her period, while thinking she was á

Fear to come and live in Nijmegen.
When the coach of our team degraded me to the second team.

Spending the nitht with close friends, after being away (out of á

In college, I started a discussion with the teacher referring to á

When my boyfriend once again told me that he loved me after a á

When a friend, after being free of drugs for half a year, started á

Watching a football game. This remindes me of the time when my á

A younger brother of a good friend of mine died (asthma).

During the funeral of my grandmother, when I saw my mother and á

I thought that someone was angry with me but, by hindsight, that á

When talking with my sister, she often ventilates prejudices, á

I was in a hopeless situation in a dirty place. No study, no á

Passing an examination, although I felt sure I had failed.

I lived in a student-house, where you shared the lavatory and á

I suffer form a disease of my muscles. However, I cannot talk á

When armed robbers broke into our house at night.

When a pick-pocket robbed me of my money (K20) while I  was á

The day I learnt that I had been admitted to the university.

 Before going in to see it I was afraid as it was the first time á

I have high expectations for my future but if I pursue the á

Occurs frequently. A recent experience: when going out with many á

I felt very lonely, was very dissatisfied with myself when I á

When someone does not listen to me after having asked me to á

I felt very sad when I heard that a friend had committed suicide.

For a few days I felt very miserable, distressed and listless, á

Out on a weekend with a group of people, everybody felt irritated á

Recently I felt very sad without any reason. It lasted for a few á

When my boyfriend and I experience something nice or when we have á

The weather is very bad (fog and slipperiness) the newcast á

I had to call someone and make an appointment for a conversation. á

I had a good relationship with two friends. Once without reason, á
they clearly showed that they thought I was naive, dull and á
unable to take care for myself, while I expostulated that I could á
manage things.

A few days ago, I hitch-hiked to Arnhems with a friend. á
Everything went well: they picked us up very quickly, the sun was á
shining, I was feeling free and, for the first time after long á
time, happy. I really had the feeling that I was living at full á
speed.

My grandmother several times has been struck by cerebral á
hemorrhages. Until now she recovered well each time, but there is á
always the threat to loose her.

I had made an appointment with three friends. We had to go out á
together. When I arrived at the place, the other persons weren't á
there. I became very angry because I thought they were gone á
without me. That, however, didn't appear to be the case.

I finished the relationship with my boyfriend, after having felt á
myself very unhappy for a long time.

A close relative of mine underwent a difficult operation, and everything á
turned out fine.

When I get into the tube or the train without paying for the á
ticket.

A class-mate urged me to carry out a particular protest along á
with him, and when the time came this fellow drew back while I á
had to face the situation.
When I failed the entrance exam to IMEC.
When they told me that I had got a study grant.
When my father was saved from a severe work accident.

When I was a child I hid under the sheets out of fear of á
darkness.
When I first saw a person begging.
When my basket ball team lost the qualification at a final.

When I got to know that I had passed the university entrance á
exam.  I thought that I had done one of the exams badly.

When I was very young, one day, I was in the street with my á
father and brother.   While my father was talking to some á
friends, I saw a dog and began to pat it.  My father told me á
sharply to stop doing it because the dog had mange.  Then my á
brother told me that I would die and I could not stop crying á
after this.

We hitch hiked our way back from a town rather drunk.  We were á
dropped in another town which was unknown to us.  I needed to á
urinate, so I did it on a wall which turned out to belong to the á
military headquarters.  They arrested me and made me pay a fine á
of 500 pts.  We had to go home on foot (6 km) since it was too á
late for anyone to give us a lift.

I was to meet a girl in a discotheque.  She was very pretty and I á
was very happy.  But she did not turn up.  Thank God, there were á
some other friends there and I was able to have a more or less á
good time.

The day some friends of mine and I decided to go to Galicia on á
holiday.
Before an exam which I, finally did not take.
At home when they lost three pieces of my puzzle.
When I had an argument with a friend.

A friend of mine told me that I had passed the entrance exam to á
the university.
Before taking an exam.

My family told me to leave if I was not willing to accept the á
conditions they imposed on me.

A friend of mine called me when I was not at home.  I phoned her á
back to know what she wanted and she told me that she had dialled á
the wrong number.
When my brother was born.

When I almost fell down from some rocks because I had been acting á
foolishly and playing dangerously.
Once I saw some children hunting a cat to death.
The death of a friend.

When I saw that I had passed the university entrance exam.  It á
made me forget all my problems.

When I was ten I got shut in the school with a friend.  I had to á
jump out of a window and cross a beam 10 metres high.

When I was told that a boy did not want to be my friend without á
any apparent reason.

When I learnt that a boy I liked had been with a girl for three á
years.

When I saw my 16 year old sister at home after having waited for á
her all night, not knowing where she was.

While I was waiting for them to give me the marks of the most á
difficult subject this year.

I had an argument with my mother because I criticized the rules á
she imposes at home, which are too rigid and arbitrary for me.

When I learned that a friend of mine had not been speaking to her á
boyfriend for a week after an argument because of unfounded á
jealousy.

After several days delay in my girlfriend's menstration I was á
very glad to see that the pregnancy test was negative.

When I saw a TV program on the North American military plan á
called "The startwar".

I felt angry when I saw on T.V the last slaughter of negroes in á
South Africa.
When I saw the pictures of the draught in Etiopia.

The day the Real Madrid team of basket ball qualified for the á
final at Athens.

The last time I was face to face with with the monstrous dog á
which lives in my street.

During a trivial (friendly) discussion, one of the participants á
made an intervention which made me feel uncomfortable.

When I heard the last regulation of the socialist govrenment á
concerning pensions.
When I passed an important exam.

In a rather important exam, when they caught me red handed á
copying.

When my father addressed me directly and maliciously, thus á
including me in the "family war".
When my parents got divorced.
When I passed an exam which I had failed last year.
When I go out alone at night.
A murder.
When I failed two subjects last year.

When I was told that I could take a week off and go for a trip á
with my friends.
Every time I went home with my school report.

During an argument between friends, one of them accused me of á
taking advantage of some other friends who usually come to the á
university in my car, saying that I ask them too much money for á
the petrol.
When I learned that two of my friends had had a serious car accident.

When I saw that I had passed an exam.  It was the last chance and á
there was a lot at stake.

On a trip to Santander we wanted to stop at a curve because a á
friend was sick, and the car skidded of the gravel.

My cousins were playing at home and one of them broke a decorative á
object which was very precious to me.

All my friends arranged to go for an afternoon snack and they did á
not tell me.  They told me that they did not have my phone number á
but I do not think that this was true.

When I pass exams, or when a close friend of mine recovered á
from an illness,etc.

Fights that I see in the middle of the street, robberies, fear of á
darkness when going home.

During a family discussion on my future and my prospects as a á
student, they accused me of not bothering about looking for a job to á
assume my financial situation.
[ Depressions.]

When I met a very close friend of mine after one year of á
separation.

There was an earthquake for several minutes and I was on the á
eight floor.

An argument among several friends because of the irrational á
behavior of one of them who fell out with us for no reason and á
said that we were to blame.

A class-mate died after being two months in coma, after a car á
accident.
When my sister was born.
When they tried to rob me.
When I failed an exam unfairly.
When my grandmother died.
When my little sister was born.

When I was attending an authorized demonstrationand the police á
rushed brutally at the demonstrators, without any warning.

When a professor of this faculty laughed at, and was suspicious of á
a composition written by a class-mate and me.
The death of a relative, friend, or someone I esteem.
When I passed an exam.
When they threatened me with a knife to take my money.
When I failed an exam I thought I would pass.
When my dog died.

I had not seen my brother for five years as he was not in Spain.   á
When he arrived at the airport, I felt great joy.
When two drug addicts tried to take away my money.
When I saw my brother being attacked and I could not do anything.
When a class-mate died.

I got my driving licence after they had frightened me with it's á
difficulty.

When I had to walk over three kms through a field which had wild bulls, á
because my car had broken down.

When I saw a man hitting a child of 2 years without any consideration, á
simply because the child had been leaning against a window.

A friend of mine who was driving a car ahead of me died in a á
car accident.

When I saw that the mark I had obtained in an exam was a good á
one.

We were in the country and I walked away from the others one á
night.  Suddenly something moved sharply in front of me and I was á
not able to see what it was.

When I was young, I became very angry as I was not allowed to á
stay up all night for the fair in my town.

When summer is over and I have to leave the town where I spend my á
holidays.

When I learned, after the ecography, that my mother was expecting a á
baby girl.  That was what I wanted.

One night, walking along a park, I began to think that some á
roughnecks would appear suddenly with knives and things like á
that.

I had an exam and I had it well prepared.  I did the first part á
very well but did not know the second part.
When my parents did not let me go on a study tour.

An invitation to spend 5 days at the seaside with all expenses á
paid.
A film on zombies.

When males in my family try to assign house duties exclusively á
with referance to sex.

I had a quarrell with my boyfriend and decided to finish with him á
and and my Easter holidays.
When I passed the university entrance exam.

When I was walking down the street, some boys showed me a knife á
and stole all my money.

When they threw my holder down on the floor, with all my notes for á
an exam inside it and they got all mixed up.
When my mother was operated.

My father had an operation which lasted for hours.  We were all á
very worried but it was successful.

I was walking along a subway when I saw a group of louts.  I was á
rather afraid because I was alone.

An old woman was violently thrown down the stairs of the tube by á
a group of louts.

A child, 9 years old, died in a stupid way.  He fell from a place á
which was 1 metre high.

I was studying in the library and a class-mate told me that she á
had obtained a grant to work in the library.

Before knowing my marks I was not sure that I wanted to go to á
that class.

I learned that a class-mate had given a list, of peolpe who help á
each other in exams, to the professor.

I phoned two friends and was not able to arrange a meeting with á
either of them, so I had to change my plans.
The begining of my relations with my current girlfriend.

When I am alone at night after having read horror stories, and á
then I heard unexplainable noises.
A typical family argument.
The disqualification of two of my mates in the military service.
When I pass an exam.
Continous fear of a nuclear war.

When you kill yourself with work and see the number of slakers á
wandering around, doing nothing.
When someone in my family died.

I thought that I was going to fail a subject and so I began to á
study for the final exam, then my friend told me that I had á
passed it.  That meant that I could go home, as I do not study in á
my hometown.

I was in Sierra Nevada, climbing a peak over 3,000 metres high, á
without any light and with many other problems.  I was afraid for á
my life.

I was living in a flat where things did not go very well for me.  á
Finally, they threw me out and this prejudiced people I esteem a á
lot.

When I read the diary of the girl with whom I was living, it was á
about another boy with whom she had been going around some time back.

I met a girlfriend again after not seeing her for several months. á
 I saw her in a discotheque.  We do not like discotheques but we á
went there because we knew we would meet there.

I was walking in the countryside alone when I came across two á
dogs who began barking at me.  I did not know whether they were á
tied up or loose, but I was afraid of them approaching me.

I was angry when my sister began to talk nonsense and to laugh at á
the way I swept the room.  My anger grew (I tried to control á
myself).  After telling her to leave me alone, I vented my anger á
on her as she did not obey me.

My mother was working with a knife and we were all laughing á
heartily.  She was not able to control the knife and stuck it á
deep into her hand.

A friend of mine suggested that I become a film extra.  The idea á
seemed very funny to me and my reaction seemed rather outlandish á
to the others.

One day I went to the cinema to see a film in which I was á
interested.  On arriving there I saw a long queue (which I had á
not expected) and went back home without seeing the film.

When I miss the train and I am late, and I have to wait half an á
hour for the next one.
When I knew I had to go out with my mother on some errands.

When they phoned me from Great-Britain to tell me that I could go á
there, if I wished, in Summer.
When I was operated on the knee and had to go through rehabilitation.

In a very important basket-ball match where a lot was at stake, I á
played very badly.

When a friend of mine told me that he was going to commit á
suicide.

When I passed my driving test, as it was the fifth time that I á
had taken this test.
When my mother was robbed in a shop.

I was given an exam which I thought did not measure at all my á
ability or my knowledge of the subject.

When I saw the film "Johnny got his gun" which deals with the á
consequences of the Vietnam war.
When I passed the university entrance exam.

One night, while I was sleeping, I woke up suddenly with the á
sensation that there was someone in my room.
When my brother was held up and robbed.
When they told me that my grandfather was rather ill.

I came across a friend with whom I had lost touch for a long á
time.

I had decided to propose to the man I liked to make a trip á
together.  One day, during breakfast I told him my idea.  I was á
afraid of his not accepting it and that the idea would end up as á
a failure.

A person I trusted a lot gave me many false explanations to á
justify a wrong action.

I was having breakfast with a classmate and suddenly I began to á
cry as I thought of a friend of mine whom I had not seen for a á
long time.

At a party, on New Year's Eve, I met on old friend whom I had not á
seen for some time

Once I failed seven subjects at school and I was terrified to á
give my report card to my father.  I left it on the table and went to á
bed very early in order to avoid him seeing me.

When, after drinking a glass of water, I found a cockroach walking á
out of the glass.

I have a very close friend who lives in another city and we have á
been writing to each other for a long time.  The last time I went á
to her city, just to see her, I was disappointed to see how great á
the distance between us was.

Every time, in the last few days, when my girlfriend told me that á
she loves me.

I stayed alone in the dark at night in the mountain, waiting for á
my uncle.  I remember that I took a big stone and it calmed me.

We were at school, in the room for audiovisual classes.  We were á
watching a film, and just behind me two classmates were bothering á
me with their mocking and shoves.  I reacted angrily (I suppose)  á
by hitting one of them.

[ During a summer holiday a French girl and I had becoe back á
home, I felt very sad.]
A party I went to last Christmas.
When my mother had a nervous illness.
During my last exam.
When I had to come back from my village last Christmas.
When I knew the feelings of a beloved person.
A fall during a climb, with almost with no previous experience.

On the occasion of assignment of tasks and responsibilities in á
which such an assignment, dispropotionately carried with it high á
responsibility and low ability of organisation and resolution.

Moving to an unknown place, away from the familiar surroundings á
and into a situation of loneliness.

In a dark street at 4 o'clock in the night and there was á
complete silence.

When they broke the artistic work of several weeks.  Changes were á
made and it was broken without permission, they had no right to á
do this.

When the train taking me to my military service left the station, á
on the platform remained relatives, projects and goodtimes.  I á
had a hard year ahead.

I was talking to a friend and he said something which was very á
funny.

When I was young I saw a horror film.  Then when I went to sleep, á
the film came back too my mind and the characters frighteneed my á
imagination.

In a confrontation with a person, he provoked me several times á
till I reacted in an angry way.  Fortunately there were no á
disastrous consequences.
I was watching a sad film and it affected me deeply.

When I knew that there were, at last, no problems in making a á
journey that I had been wanting to make for a long time.
It was more that fear - anguish -that I felt before my last exam.

When I had an argument with my best friend and I thought that I á
was right and she was not.

When I realized that it was impossible for me to be as free as I á
had imagined and that I could not do anythong about it.

When a study tour got confirmed, I was happy all the time till    á
the tour began.

I was walking down a road and suddenly a few dogs appeared at a fence á
and started barking angrily.  They were jumping and it seemed á
that they would come for me any time.

When I knew that they would not give me a transfer from one á
university to another.  I began to insult the educatioon á
authorities and the government, I ended up at the door.

We went to visit my mother at the residence.  She was crying and á
said that she was about to die.  I believed all her complaints á
and continously thought of the possibility of loosing her.

When I received my report card in C.O.U.  I was afraid of obtaining á
low marks, but they were much higher than expected.

I was at the cinema with my sister and her boyfriend.  A man á
sitting beside me started to stroke my leg for a while, he left in á
the middle of the film.

My father began to say incoherant things concerning my brother's and á
my own behaviour towards him.  His biased (authoritarian) and á
ridiculous point of view made us angry.
I had failed some subjects in mathematics.

When I fell crazily in love with a beautiful girl and she returned á
my love.

When I was caught by the police and was kept with a group of á
delinquents, which added to my fear of being shut up.  I was á
afraid of the people near me and the future consequences.

When I was the target of a great many insults and completely á
unfair accusations of a large group of people.
When my best friend died, at the age of 16.

When I came across an old friend whom I had not seen for a very á
long time.

I had an accident in which I hurt my eye.  I was afraid of having á
injured it badly.
When I was accused of something I had not done.
A close friend died.

I received an unexpected letter from a friend I had met a short á
time before.  He sent me a poem and wished me good luck.  I felt á
very happy because I had great esteem for that person.

I was walking with another person when a "gang" separted us and á
pushed me in to a house, hit me in the stomach and the face, then á
they left - leaving me bleeding.

A certain person started to say dreadful things very calmly, I á
felt hurt and disgusted.

A certain person whom I respect and esteem a lot pays me no á
attention.  She keeps up appearances but shows almost no interest á
in me.

When I received some good news : I obtained an amount of money I á
needed to buy something I had been planning to buy.

When my relatives and I were in a car going slowly on a frozen á
road.

My parents were having a typical family argument.  I came in and á
saw the scene and became angry.
I was going away, leaving a dear person behind.
When I talk to my friends.
When I am walking on the streets and see a gang of thugs.
When people harrass me I feel oppressed by their behavior.
When I am with a friend and we have to leave each other.

[ Any situation in everyday life has this emotional sense, in á
class, in the street, at home, at the table..........]

On a dark night I felt that there were several people near me á
and I did not know who they were.

When I learned that several people had died in the street due to  á
the cold weather.

When I saw in the newspapers, on the T.V, and magazines the á
chaotic situation caused by the drought and hunger in á
Mauritania.

One night, at a friend's place I realized that I had everything I á
most wished, around me.

During a demonstration I climbed up the closed central door of a á
bus.  When the bus stopped I had to go back to the same place, á
afraid that the police would see me.

When I saw parents punishing their little child for something he á
had not done.  In my opinion, even if he had done it he should á
not have been punished for it.

A friend of mine was hurt as he thought that our relationship was á
not the same as before and something had gone wrong.

When they told me that I had been admitted to the faculty of á
medicine.
Almost always when I go to fetch the results of an exam.
[ No description.]

When I decided not to out any longer with a girl whom I liked á
quite a lot.  This made me feel low for a some time.
When I obtained good marks in a subject I had failed before.
When a friend of mine told me a horror story.

I was with my family and we found some abandoned puppies.  I á
wanted to help them but everyone said no.  We then left.
At my grandfather's death.

When I was told that they had got tickets for me for a film á
marathon I wanted to see.

We were on the road in a car when a lorry bypassed us.  We had to á
swerve and we almost got run over.

I had applied for a job and they had assured me that the exams á
would take place a few months later.  A week later I went to á
obtain some more information and they told me that the exams had á
already taken place.

I received a letter from some friends, who do not live in Madrid, á
telling me that they would not come on holiday.  I had arranged á
everythiing for them.
The man I am going around with gave me a very special present.

I thought that I would be scolded for a comment I had made, which á
I should not have made.

My sister came back home and reproached me for not having tidied á
up the house, although I had been working all morning and she had á
done nothing.

At my grandfather's funeral.  I remembered that the thing he á
liked and respected most was earth, I thought that he had á
attained what he wanted and was not separated from it any longer.

When I saw a friend of mine, whom I had not seen for a long time á
and I had lost his address and telephone number.

I was in my village when a bull jumped over a fence and started á
chasing my friends and me.  We were very frightened till we á
climbed up a tree.
When I saw a car run over a child, out of carelessness.

I failed a subject despite the fact that I had studied quite a á
lot for it.

I was spending the week-end with some friends.  We were waiting á
for another friend and we went to the meet him at the bus stop, a  á
woman we met there told us that the coach had already left.  I á
was afraid that I would not see my friend, but at last we found á
him.

I was walking down a little village at night.  There was nobody á
in the steet.  A dog began to bark, I felt that it was following á
me.  Then I began to run, the other dogs started barking too.  At á
last I arrived home.
My parents did not let me go on holidays with my friends.
I was told that a friend of mine was going to Mexico for good.

I was on holidays, and I was going to meet a friend whom I had á
not seen for six months.  Again I felt very happy.

We were camping in the mountains, and a friend and I went for a á
walk.  It was getting darker and darker and we were not sure of á
the right way back.

I sent a book to a friend of mine.  The book meant a lot to me á
and he lost it.
To say goodbye to dear friends after the holidays.

My sister in law was about to have a child, and there were some á
problems.  They had to do a Caesarean.  After a while, everything  á
was all right.
Waiting for my marks in a difficult subject.

I gave some personal information to a friend of mine, and he told á
it to some others who were implicated in the affair.

The holidays come to an end, and the next day we had to go back á
to University and to the exams.

Last course, when I passed with good marks three subjects which I had á
previously failed.
I was attacked by a man at a bus stop at night.

My mother told me that I could not go to the mountains.  Despite á
my age, as long as I am in her house I must do what she says.

When my nephew was taken to hospital with meningitis and we did á
not know what would happen.

One evening, I was with a group of friends having a talk.  There á
was a very trustful and joyful atmosphere.

We were walking in the park at night.  It was very dark and very á
late.  We began to hear foot steps all around us, and we could á
not find our way out.

[ One day I arrived home rather tired and found the house..... In á
addition I was asked many questions which I did not want to á
answer.]

I was selected to do a rest for a foreign ballet but I did not á
have the money to do it.

It was Saturday, my duties were over for a few hours and I could á
at last be with the people I wanted to see.

One night, I was alone at home.  My fear was caused by some á
strange noises which put my imagination to work.

When I got to know about the reaction of a friend of mine in a á
certain situation.  I had not expected him to react that way.

I felt alone among a large number of people.  I was sad to see á
that nobody cared about what was happening to me.

I was going to my village, after having been rather oppressed in á
Madrid.

I was watching a procession during the Holy week, and a penitent á
approached me.

My mother read a letter that a friend of mine had written to me á
telling me how she had got drunk the last time.
[ No response.]

Last Summer I achieved someting that I had been wanting for a á
long time.

I was in a camp and went out for a walk at night on my own.  I lost  á
my way and spent several hours looking for the camp.

My parents scolded me a lot for something I had not done.  It was á
my sister who had done it.
[ No response.]

When my brother was born, everything went all right.  It had been á
very likely that he would have a deficiency (my sister suffers á
from Down's Syndrome) and that my mother would be in danger.

When we got lost in Florence and the coach did not turn up until á
midnight.  I had no place to go to and there were strange reports á
at the police station.

When an English teacher unfairly made me repeat a semester which á
I thought I had passed.  I had to ask my parents for some more á
money to carry on studying.

The person whom I liked most left me for a friend of mine, after á
several months of mutual help and a profound knowledge of each á
other.

When I passed the university entrance exam.  I had thus finished á
with a difficult period of my life and I was about to begin one á
which I had desired a lot.

When I was at home alone, I felt a super-natural force, dangerous á
for me and the people close to me.

When my father made my mother go through really terrible á
situations, I felt furious, impotent, nervous, upset, ........

When a person whom I loved and admired a lot died.  I felt empty, á
lonely, helpless, without support, not knowing what to do.
On my birthday, when I was given my presents.

We were riding in a friend's car.  He was driving very fast and á
suddenly a another car crossed the road in front of us.  My á
friend had to turn the car rapidly.

When I found one of my new pullovers wrinkled inside the á
wardrobe.  My brother had done it.

When I went to see the result of an exam and saw that I had á
failed.

The final marks were to be given in the morning.  I wanted to get á
there late because I was very afraid.  When I arrived there, á
everybody was very happy and I had also passed.  We had a á
wonderful time all day long.

I went to visit a friend in hospital.  He was going to be á
operated the next day.  I was afraid that they would not let me á
in and I did not know what his reaction would be on seeing me.

A friend of mine played a joke on another friend over the á
telephone.  This friend, crying, called me and I got very angry á
and made the other person apologize.

A friend of mine told me that my boyfriend had been with another á
girl this Summer.  We had been going out together for four years á
and we had not done so for the last three months.  I could not á
believe it.
On holiday, seeing the lanscape in Gerona.
Travelling by coach on a rather narrow and wet road.

They wanted me to pay for a ticket twice because they said that á
the one I had was out of date.
When I came back from my holidays.

When some friends of mine asked me to go camping with them for a á
fortnight.

Once, when I was very young, my mother left me alone in the á
house and came back very late.

When my aunt told me angrily that I was a good-for-nothing and á
she was fed up with my behaviour.

When my parents and sister went on a trip and I was separated á
from them for about three months.

I phoned a friend of mine to ask her for news about the marks in á
an exam.  She told me that I had passed.

I was spending my summer holidays in a village.  My friend and I á
were coming back from a discotheque at night and we heard a noise á
from an alley.  We were very scared and we got into my friend's house. á
 A moment later, an unknown car picked up a person from this á
alley.

My mother and I had an argument over buying some clothes for me.  á
She did not accept the fact that I did not like the same things á
as her, and we ended up shouting at each other.

One day, I was home and there was a phone call informing me that á
some of my relatives had died in an accident.

I was told that I had passed the statistics exam.  I had not á
expected this so I was very happy.

When my brother hit his head and lost consciousness at the sports á
practice.  For some time he could not remember what had happened á
but he recovered later.

I get angry with my brothers and sisters when they do something á
that I do not like.  They know this and still do it so as to á
tease me.
When my grandfather died.

When I spoke to my daughter and wished her luck for the á
examinations she was about to take.

When I was told that my daughter, who is at a boarding school, á
was very ill and that they needed me there the same day.

One day in a clinic, the father of a child came in and assaulted á
a colleague for something that she had not done deliberately.
When I was told that my uncle had passed away.

When a cousin of mine was discharged from the hospital after       á
a long illness.  I had thought that this illness would never end.

When a man who had a knife grabbed me and threatened me with it,   á
during my holidays in Monze.á

A certain friend tried to push me off a seat in a very violent á
way for no apparent reason.  It may be that he was excited about á
something.

When the neighbour of a friend of mine was stabbed to death by á
thieves in Kabwe.  They stole his van.

After going through much shame, I became a Christian and á
something new happened in my heart.  Joy that overflows was á
manifest in me.

When I was about six years old, I mistook a cat for a leopard      á
when it entered my room at night.

When a person the same age as me insisted that I call him á
"Mister".  I refused to succumb, but he persisted and I got angry á
as he had belittled me.

When I lost my father on the 25th of September,1970.  He died of á
a sore on the leg.
When I first passed a job interview.

I was almost caught in the girls hostel by the security men, I á
would have been expelled from school had I been caught.

When I was accused of having refused to do some hostel work while á
I was at school.  Actually I had not been allocated any work.

A friend of mine could not make it back to Unza after having á
failed the exams.
When I heard that I had made it to the second year at UNZA.

When my father's home was to be broken into by thieves who had á
guns.

When a friend tried to back bite me on false grounds.  This made á
me wonder if he was a really a good friend.
When my girlfriend's nephew passed away.

When I hooked a girl in Kitwe.  She was very beautiful for my á
standards, a rare bird of this kind accepted me as a boyfriend.
When someone tried to bewitch me and my friends at night.

When I was victimized for running away with a girl who was á
somebody else's wife and niece at the same time.  I was very á
angry over this issue because I was told to pay him money after á
having been punished for it.

1976, Soweto uprising in South Africa and the racist Gout's á
reaction to the students demands concerning the educational á
system.

When I was accepted for further education, here at the á
university.

When I was walking at night, I saw fire suspended in the air and á
it was split into several segments by something I could not see.  á
I suspected that it was witch-craft.

When I was accused by my brother of having stolen a 5 kwatcha á
note from my mother's bag.  I was beaten up for this, the money á
was found later.

When I received a message that my brother was seriously ill and á
was in hospital.
When I got first division in the exams before leaving school.

When I went to town in a double dekker bus.  The bus was about to á
fall on the way when the driver controlled it.  It had almost á
fallen.

When I was in form 3, my aunts lied to my daddy telling him that á
I had told them that I was pregnant.  My daddy  told my mother á
and she asked me if it was true.  I was very angry with my aunts.
When I received a letter telling me that my mother was very ill.
When I had my four children.
When two of my children were critically ill with measles.
When I got a low grade in an administration course.
When I got divorced from my husband after ten years of marriage.

This happened when I went to check my first year results, I had  á
thought that I would fail and I found that I had a clear pass in á
all my courses.

When I woke up at night to find a fire spreading towards the bed á
-rooms.  I was very frightened as I realized that I faced death.
When a friend of mine was trying to make a fool out of me.

I experienced this emotion when my friend committed suicide after á
we had spent the afternoon playing and discussing life and it's á
problems.
When I was told that I had passed the exams.
When a thief broke into my house at night.
When my sister broke my china tea set.
I felt very sad when my son died after a short illness.
When I learnt that I was selected for form I.
When I was nearly beaten up by the brother of my girlfriend.

When I heard that my girlfriend was talking behind my back and á
looking down on me.

When a friend, who has been with me at school, failed to make it á
to UNZA.
When I passed the grade 7 exam.

When I was told by the doctor, after many months of coughing, á
that I had tuberculosis.

When a cousin of mine took my bottle of T.B tablets, put water in á
it and threw it in the dust-bin.

This happened when one of my uncles died just whan I was á
planning to go and visit him during the next holidays.
The time I qualified to enter secondary school.

One evening I saw the old guard-man I knew, change into something á
inhuman for about 5-10 seconds, this really frightened me.

When I was mistakenly accused of being a thief when I accidently á
gave a fake coin at a counter.  I realized this before I handed á
over the coin, but the man called me a thief and called a á
witness.

The day I woke up to find that a kitten I had wanted to keep had á

wife who claimed that it had dirtied the sheets.

I felt joy when I came to know Christ.  That is when I became a á
Christian.
When I broke the window pane of my next door neighbour's house.

When my brother did not send me the transport money to resume      á
my studies in time at UNZA.
When I heard that my nephew had passed away.

When my uncle gave me my first year's results.  I opened the á
envelope and my eyes ran into two "B+" - in EC110 and M160, this á
meant that I had qualified for a major in economics.

I turned the knob of my granny's two band radio and did not hear á
any broadcast,  " What ! Have I broken the knob ? How much does á
it cost ? What if the spare part is not available ? "  --I did á
not know how to tune a radio.

I peeped into Maurine's bedroom and saw two people - Maurine anbd á
my step-dad.  I thought, " Why did she break her promises ? Why á
had she invited me ? Why do old men go for young girls ? "

When I missed the chance of becoming a graduate in mining á
engineering, after having prayed one week in the church I was á
not even selected.

This was when the girl I was in love with accepted my proposal á
and everything went smoothly, just as I had wanted it to.  It was á
contrary to my previous feelings of uncertainty about her á
response.

It was when I dreamt that I had encountered Satan, he wanted to grab me á
and take me to his kingdom.  He was very repulsive and I have á
never seen anything like that before.

This was when I found out that a cousin of mine had taken away my á
trousers without my consent.

When I failed a test at my primary school.  I was then in grade 7 á
and we were about to take the main exam.

I was in grade 7.  We had an inter-house volley-ball competition. á
 In Luapula I was the youngest member of the team and I scored  á
the winning goal using my head.  I jumped up with joy and fell á
down.

I was escorting a relative on a bike, we passed by a dark road á
with bushas on each side.  Half way down this road, suddenly, we   á
saw a white dog appear from one side.  Before we could do á
anything, it had vanished and moreover it did not seem to have á
any legs.

The comrade staying next doors insulted me for what he called  á
the misuse of his iron.  He called me stupid, self centered etc.  á
I wanted to punch him but instead went for a walk to the mining á
school to cool off.

A close relative was at odds with a very powerful firm.  All his á
things had been taken, His dad had died a little before this á
event.  He gathhered his children and vowed to give them a good á
life with a new start - the words were hollow, he bit back his á
tears .....I asked to be excused and then went and cried in the á
loo.

I was at school whhen I received a letter from the dean of my á
school congratulating me for my performance at the previous á
year's exam.

This was at secondary school, a prefect framed up some case and á
took it to the deputy head-master.  I was called by the á
head-master and he threatened to suspend me.

When I travelled all the way to my former school to collect my á
certificate, only to be told that I owed them some money, I knew á
nothing about this.

My sister was in a hospital, later in the evening we received the á
information that she had died.
My being admitted to UNZA.
While paddling in the river during a storm.  I feared drowning.

I entrusted a friend with the delivery of some money to my á
father, however he misused the money.
The loss of my mother.
My first kiss.
When I saw a ghost.
My trouser's zipper was open when I was at a public wedding.
When a friend left me and went back home for good.
When I passed my form three exams.

The time I was threatened with expulsion from secondary school (form á
four).

When I discovered that the people I trusted most were talking á
behind my back.
When I heard about the death of my aunt.

As the time to get the results drew near I became more and more á
anxious.  My friend called me and said, " You have passed."  My á
heart was full of joy.

I watched a very terrfying film in LT2.  This film really pushed á
my heart out of my body and I was forced to go out before the á
second reel ended.

" I have been hearing rumours that you have not been allowing á
people in your room," he said.  This sentence really shot my á
heart.  I failed to find the right words, instead I walked away á
without uttering a word.

One Saturday morning I had got ready to go out swimming with my á
friends.  Unfortunately the weather did not permit it, so we á
stayed indoors.

When I heard that a close relative of mine had given birth at a á
very young age, in a very remote area and had had very few problems.
The possibility of having failed the examination.
When someone chased me from his house.

When I realized that I did not have the basic things needed by a á
student like me.

My girlfriend wrote to me telling me that she was four months á
pregnant and that I was responsible for the "damages".  This made á
me happy as I longed to have a child to call mine.

The shooting started and we all lay down to protect ourselves á
from the flying bullets.  This incident occured on our way to á
Feira, during the Zambia army patrols in the Rhodesia war.

I went to the dining hall and found that the cooks were cleaning á
the plates and there was no food for me, and the blue birds  á
(security guards) were busy eating the food that was supposed to á
be for me.

That afternoon I received two messages informing me, one that my á

 to see my brother.

When a girl I wanted very much, said "yes" and fell in love with  á

One evening, when I had gone fishing with my friends, we heard á

When somebody stole my brother's disco machine.
When my uncle died.

I was very happy when I discovered that I had passed my first á
year examination and was among the thirty students who would á

I was approaching my exam time and my books got stolen.  I was in á
a panic as I thought that I would not do well enough to be á
considered for the economics quota.  I cried a lot but that did á
not help and as the exam day came near a strange fear gripped me.

I was annoyed this particular day as it seemad that the odds were á
not in my favour.  My grandfather added fuel to the fire, when I  á
had an important appointment so I unleashed my anger on him.

It was the time I went home for my holidays only to find that my á

that I could take my exams.
When I was accepted at UNZA.
When I heard a lion roar for the first time.

When a friend told me that my education had nothing to do with á
our discussion.  This friend has failed the 7th grade, what made á
me angry was that I had not used my education to argue.
When my beloved grandfather died.

I experienced joy when I got the results - I had made it to the á
second year.

When I was going home, I saw somathing which looked like a snake   á
on the road but later I found out that it was only a stick.

This happened recently, I  was in the dining hall and one of my á
friends with whom I was eating called me a fool.

I experienced this when my maternal grandmother passed away.  She á
was the last of my grand parents to pass away.
When my first child was born.

I was walking through a thick forest and there was a big snake at á
a distance of about four metres.

When my daughter began staying away from classes - at the age of á

When my wife died in hospital, she was pregnant and had undergone á

I received a letter of acceptance from UNZA.

We were driving at night and I realized that a car was following á

I reachad home to find that my baby had not been bathed and fed.

I saw a dead child which was not covered, it had been knocked á

When I was appointed by the Ministry of health to join the á

When I took blood from a patient for alcohol estimation and á

When the dean of UNZA asked me to vacate a big flat I was á

When my close friend was involved in an accident and passed away á

When I received my promotion letter.

I was sleeping when I heard the neighbours screaming, I peeped á

I was annoyed when a person higher up asked me why a particular á

My brother came to tell me about some problems we had in the  á

When I was accepted for my third year (G-10) at my former á

I had gone for a medical check-up at the U.T.H and failed to make á

When I was mistreated by my step-mother.
When my aunt passed away in early 1982.

When I heard that someone who is very close to me did very well á

When a drunkard barged into a room where my friend and I had run á

When a friend and me played a joke on our boyfriends.  Her á

When my family and I heard of the death of my grandfather.  We had á
 seen him a few weeks earlier and it seemed that he had just been á

After a long time (of no communication with him, physical á

Birds had made nests in our thatched roof and they were flying á

The juniors in our dormitory at school started to complain and á

My elder sister scolded me in front of my younger sisters and á

My son was registered to get admission in grade one of the         á

Two weeks later I was informed that he had been enrolled.

When I came back from work one day, the friends of my son told me á

My room-mate locked up our room without specifying where I would á

I lost my grandfather whom I loved very much.  I had not known á

When my father bought me a suit.
After having taken an exam i feared having failed it.

I was badly beaten up by one of my friends during a wedding á
