I was very sad at hearing that my grandfather had passed away.
When I heard that I had achieved a place in form I.

When I first came to the UNZA I did not know the kind of people I á

I had gone home for a week-end and when I came back I found that á

When my father passed away.
When I saw my family after a separation of one year.

When my little sister was sick at home and I thought that she á

When I found out that my sister had been playing with my á

When one of my best friends commited siucide during these á

When I fell in love with "X".  Overnight I felt confidence, self-esteem,    á

When a thunder belt hit the roof top of the building I was in.

When my room-mate locked me out deliberately, before an exam due á

When my friends died one after the other.  The first died in a á

The day I got a telegram telling me that I had been selected for á

The day I encountered a queer mamba face to face in a chunk of á

When my friends tried to discriminate against my friendship with á

The day my teacher of Latin and French died.

I was very happy when I received the year end results as I was á

I was caught doing something I was not supposed to do.  I did á
something with the person who caught me (bribe) and even though á

I told my friend something confidential which was supposed to á
remain between the two of us.  The next thing that happened was á

I remember that when my mother died the day was sad and every á

When I received a positive answer from my appeal to withdraw my á

I was a passenger in a vehicle when suddenly another vehicle came á

I was asked to stop studying economics, a field which interested á

When I learnt of the death of a friend.
When I first came to the campus.

When I was confronted by a policeman one night around 11 o'clock. á
 I was afraid when they threatened to take me and my girl to the á
gallows.

When an argument with a friend of mine over our behaviour towards á
another friend turned into a quarrel.   I lost my temper and nearly á

When I lost my father in a car accident.

When I got my results - I had passed the form III exams.  I had á

When I was an exploration with my friends and almost got lost in á

When my father did not get back from Chipata on time, he was thus á

When my little brother passed away mysteriously, at least from á
what I was told about it.
When I was accepted at UNZA.

When thieves broke into our neighbour's house and later we heard á
gunshots.

When my aunt scolded me for something I was not responsible for.  á
A boy had come to our gate asking for me, my aunt went out to see á
him.  I had neither met nor known the boy.

When my cousin passed away unexpectedly and tragically (a á
murder).
Receiving my result slip (pass) on my birthday.

When we forced a friend to chew a poisonous herb in primary á
school.  His tongue was swollen and he told his mother about it.  á
The mother reported it to the headmaster who threatened to expel á
us.

At boarding school someone put a lot of tiny thorns on my bed.  á
When I complained everybody began teasing me and laughing at my á
inability to find out my enemies.  I lost my temper.
When my grandfather died.

I felt vvery happy when I was accepted at UNZA for my studies.  á
I had not expected this as I had been ill during the exams.

I felt very frightened when a robber broke into our house and á
threatened to shoot my father if he did not part with some money. á
 I was looking at the man with his hand on the trigger.

A teacher at my former secondary school forced my darling to á
marry him.  The girl tried to refuse but her parents would not á
leave her alone.

When my sister died, she was only sixteen when she was put to á

When I won some coins in a small competion.

I went home late one evening and saw that the security lights á

My little niece, who is very talkative, suddenly became very á

This morning during my sleep I had a feeling that someboby was á

woke me up.
When I was selected for the university.

When I saw an accident, a woman was run over and she died on the á

When my dress and a few other things were stolen from my á

When my grandmother passed away.

When I got myself the kind of girlfriend I had been hunting for a á

When I was told that the form five results were out.

When I saw my younger sister being bothered by a boy she did not á

The time I lost a badminton match, that I should have won at the á

When I was selected for higher education, i.e grade 7 to formI.

When I impregnated a certain girl, I thought that I would be á
forced to marry her or go to court.

When the university withdrew the accomodation that it had given á

When my mother and father separated (it was a brief separation á
and they are together now).

When I received a letter from a woman I thought had not ever á

Two guys were fighting murderously and I feared that one of them á
would be killed.
When I could not reason my friend, it angered me.

I did not like it when a little girl was crying for her dead á
mother and was calling her by her name.  I was sad.

Our only elder sister got married and started having pains in her á
abdomen and she was told that she could not have children. To our á

My uncle was taken to the UTC for an operation as he had cancer.  á
There had been a lot of deaths of late - 3 out of every 4 á

I had planned to go to town with my friend at 1500 hours but she á
went for the registration and I waited for a good 1 and a 1/2 hours.  It á
was vital for me to go to town but I could not as it was she who á
had the money.  Finally I borrowed some money from friends and we á

I dreamt of my father's death while I was at secondary school.  I á
was screaming at the top of my voice and was woken up by my á

I was very happy when my scholarship to continue studying at UNZA á

When I met an elephant in the bush.
When someone took my pen away.

When my cousin passed away during the holidays at home.  He fell á
ill at night and the next day he died in the evening.
When I was with someone I love.
When I was walking around all alone at night.
Being made to look like a fool by a girl.
When my dad passed away.
At my sister's wedding.
When I had to walk along a dark road alone.
When I was locked out of my room by my room-mate's friend.

When I failed one of my courses at school - the university of á
Zambia.

When the lady who is now my wife accepted my proposal to be my á

When my neighbour's house was broken into and shots could be á
heard.
When a thief broke into my house and stole some valuable goods.

The death of my guardian with whom I had stayed when I did my á
grade six.

I felt happy when my mother gave birth to a son who is the last á
born in the family.

My father had been involved in a car accident two years ago.  I á
was then very scared thinking that he would die as he lay á

I felt very angry when a mishanga seller robbed me of the á
transport money I had to go to school.

I felt very sad when a friend of mine failed the final exam and á

When I was selected to study here at UNZA.

In 1960,  I was going to a school which was near my village and I á

When my wife told me that the refrigerator had stopped working.
When I heard of the death of my mother.

I was overwhelmed with joy when I received the acceptance letter á

In 1977 when my friend was caught by a crocodile.  We were á

In 1982, I was annoyed at an uncle who was drunk and was beating á

Last academic year I received bad news - my grand-uncle had á

When I qualified for form I.  I was one of the three pupils who á
qualified for form I that year.

When I learnt that the girl I had impregnated was in hospital and á

When I got home I found that the electrical supply had been á

When I lost my grandmother.  She had been my guardian after the á

When my wife gave birth to a baby boy - my only son to date.

When burglars with guns forced themselves into my house and á

When my colleague spat on my face after a quarrel.
When my elder brother died.
When my brother gave me a watch.
Whhen the front tyre of the car burst.
When I was insulted by a fellow student.
When the girl I loved turned me down.

When I passed the first year and so I could come back for my á
second year.

I was working at a certain place and everyday after work dad á
would come to pick me up.  One day he did not come, it started á
getting very dark and I had no money on me and my home was very, á

One day I had an appointment with my boyfriend which I had á
objected to in the begining, however he visited me and convinced á
me to come.  The day of the appointment; I had to wait for him á
for over an hour.

When my grandmother passed away.  We had been waiting for it as á
she had been sick for years, but when it happened I found it hard á

I was very happy when I found out that I had passed with flying á

Last night, I dreamt that things that looked like monsters were á
trying to kiss me.

One of my colleagues accused me of having stolen his iron and I á
was sure that I had done no such thing.
The passing away of my mum.
The first time I really fell in love with a girl.

The time I drove my uncle's car, without having asked for his á

I was moving in the graveyard at 6.00 pm one day and was griped á

There is a mad boy in our village. This boy hit me with a raw á

It was last September when I felt very sad. It was when I heard á

It was in December last year that I was chosen to come to this á

In March I was busy studying during the night I could only sleep á

I once caught a letter in my girlfriend's handbag from a certain á

I was once nominated as an Officer Cadet in the Armed Forces and á

There was joy in me when I heard that I was to take a course as a á

When I saw a dead body in the mortuary I became afraid and I was á

A certain Area Party Secretary came home in the morning and said á

I was so sad when I heard that my Uncle had passed away. He was á

When I was in Form 4, at Secondary School, I was elected as a á

I broke my Uncle's Radio player accidentally and so I feared that á

It was in March 1985 when one of my fellow students borrowed my á

When I was about to write my Junior Certificate Exams, I received á

The joy came to me when I heard that I was going to start a á

The emotion came when I misbehaved at school and the Principal á

The emotion came when a certain boy opened my locker without my á

The sadness came to me when I heard that my girlfriend whom I á

When I was told that I was selected to attend Medical Assistant á

When I was told to attend an operation in theatre.

When I was told that my father had passed away.

At night when I was coming from Lingadzi Inn I heard a hyena á

I felt angry when I was told that I had not been selected to go á

I felt sad when I was told to walk out of the classroom because I á

My girlfriend who had been very far away from me came to my á

I was given a wristwatch by my first girl and after two days á

My girlfriend mentioned a certain girl's name who was my girl á

I had been caught red-handed having stolen some paw-paw. I was á

This happened when I was selected to go to Secondary school to á

As I was taking venous blood from another patient I introduced á

My lovely girlfriend double-crossed me and so that I found her á

I really became sad when mother passed away while I was very á
young.

I felt joy when I passed my Malawi School Certificate of á

When I had crossed Lilongwe forest I heard that there was a rabid á

I was angry when I heard that my only girl was going about with á

When I was not selected to go to the University of Malawi I felt á

When I married my wife and took her home for the first time.
When my friend was involved in a car accident.
When I was charmed by my relatives.
When my mother died in August 1978.

My friend took me to Civo Stadium to watch and listen to the á

I had fear when I was left alone at the bus depot at night. I had á

I felt angry when I heard that my sister had failed the á

I felt sad when I heard that my girlfriend was double-crossing me á

The joy came when I first proposed a girl at Secondary School.

As I was in a ward one man died and I was instructed to watch the á

I was very angry when I heard that my brother was beaten by his á

I was very sad when I heard about the death of my teacher who á

My sister gave birth to twins, healthy ones.

I was looking after my father's sheen in the forest. One day á

I planned to travel a distance of 20 kilometres on my bike. I á

It was in the evening when I heard that my girl went to Zambia á

At primary school I was accused by some boys of being in love á

I was very angry when one day I went to see my girlfriend I á

I was very sad when I was shouted at by Uncle and was told that I á

It was August 30th when I heard on the radio that I passed my á

I was walking alone along the place where people fear that there á

I once was accused of falling in love with someone's girlfriend á

It was when I failed standard 8 exams while all my friends á

It was when I was allowed to take my wife away from her parents á

When two hyenas made crying noise on the window of my bedroom at á

It was when my Instructor awoke me late at night to get prepared á

I slept in a tent at the Barracks which caught fire at night and á

This came in when at one time I met a girl who I didn't expect to á

When I was travelling at night.

I experienced this when one of my friends reported to the á

When I was at school.

That was soon after the results of the interview which nearly á

I was once this week angry when soemone trying to compress my á

This condition accumulated in my mind when funeral news was á

It was when I was selected to go to a Secondary school to start á

It was when I stepped on a python (snake) unknowingly while it á

It was when my friend had stolen my money (K10) and had á

It was when my father was taken into detention by the CIDS for á

My brother had bowel obstruction, having heard that he was going á

I felt very angry after one driver had run over my beloved niece.

When I heard that I had passed Primary School Leaving Certificate á

When I heard that there is teasing and bulling at Secondary á

When I heard that I was not to be provided with another pair of á

When I heard that my father had passed away.

I met my girlfriend on the way and she joyfully welcomed me on á

One time I set up my journey at night going to a certain bar. On á

An incident occurred to me when I was going home with my á

When I found my baby whipped by my Auntie. I was really sad and á

I felt happy when I saw my brother at the bus depot after 3 á

When we were going to Nkhoma last Saturday the vehicle was moving á

When they put the blame on me when I scored the third goal at the á

I felt very sad when I lost my three Kwacha at civo Stadium when á

On December the 28th I was filled with Joy when I was told by my á

It was at Malawi Army, Dormer Squadron, when some of my workmates á

It was mid May 1985, When we had a Test on Nursing. My classmate á

One day I was busy day dreaming along the road and suddenly I á

When I was doing my last year at Secondary School I was robbed of á

It was on 9th January 1983 when I received a message from home á

When I had an anticipatory honey-moon with my fiancTe.

When it was found that I had gone out of the school premises á

When a classmate hit me on my occipital region when I was busy á

When my father died.

When I heard my name being announced on the radio that I had been á

One time I was injured when I was playing football at School in á

One day I was really angry when all my food was eaten by a dog. á
My anger was against my mother because she was careless. She á

One day I came across a certain boy who was intruding my á

When I was selected to start Form I at Chilumba Secondary School á

We went fishing some 5 or 8 kilometers off the shore of Lake á

I was angered by a classmate who poured soup on to my clothes. He á

Coming behind my back, he wasn't noticed by me and as I was á

I was sad when my MCE grades were out. I had gone for a football á

Someone told a lie that I had stolen his money.

My Uncle was beaten by his troublesome son. He fell unconscious á

I met a certain lady at Mchesi and I proposed a word of love to á

My father gave me money for school fees and I didn't pay school á

There was a cup final match between Limbe Leaf Wanderers and á

I had received bad news informing me that grandmother and á

As we were going to Area 10 a dog chased me. I was afraid it á

Brother took my money to use for his own purposes.

After hearing the news about the death of my sister, I felt very á

When I was selected to a University College of Nursing.

When someone took my writing materials yet I was to write á

When I was transferred from Chichiri Secondary School to St. á

When the week for Exams came. I got afraid as to how I would á

Last week a friend of mine called on me and said I was moody and á

I experienced this emotion when my grandfather passed away.

I had stayed for months without seeing mother because our á

When I heard that my Uncle had passed away in a road traffic á

When my best friend promised to come at my house and I had to á

I was angry when somebody stole my half petticoat.

A tailor ran away with my skirt.

Sometime back another girl who was in terms with my ex-boyfriend á

When I passed standard 8 exams I jumped, rolled over the ground.

The time I first saw my cousin who is living in Tanzania.

I was very sad when I heard that my uncle had passed away á

When my boyfriend came form Rumphi to Lilongwe for a visit I was á

When I dream of anything terrifying I used to have fear for the á

I had been in love with a certain young man who pretended to love á

When I heard that I had passed my end of first year exams and I á

The headmistress at a secondary school accused me of banging the á

I received a message that my elder brother was involved in a car á

When I was selected to start Form I at Malosa Secondary school.
When a thief entered the house in which I was sleeping.
When my dress was stolen.
When my grandmother died after a long illness.

I was very joyful when I heard that I had passed the standard 8 á

I was in the house at night and I heard a hyena crying outside. á

I was angry at the Cafeteria when the cook scolded and said many á

I was very sad when I heard that my Auntie had passed away.

When I heard that I had passed my MCE Exam, I spent the whole á

When I heard that my father had found a letter from my boyfriend á

When a certain boy went about saying that I am his girlfriend. I á

When I heard that my father had passed away. I could not eat for á

It was in 1983 September when MCE results were being announced on á

I was on my way home when suddenly Gule Wamkulu came from the á

A certain man went to my parents and told them that I was married á

When I went home on holidays I found that my niece and nephew had á

I was joyful when I received a present (2 books and a pencil) á

I went to the prayer meeting at night and unfortunately the car á

I was angry the other day because the teacher told me to sweep á

I was very sad when I heard that my brother had failed the á

I was happy to hear that my sister had won a prize at running á

I was afraid when I met my Uncle because this time I was with my á

I was angry when I had not been granted a leave out pass during á

I was sad to hear that my brother had a motorbike accident.
When my brother bought me a nice pair of shoes from South Africa.

I was asked to join my friend in a boat at Mangochi Lake Malawi á

Somebody took my wristwatch and promised to have it mended and á

My boyfriend didn't turn up after promising that he was coming.

After passing my Malawi Certificate of Education Exam and being á

I was sleeping alone in the house at night. A boy putting on a á

The patient whom I expected to get well suddenly passed away á

work and the responsibilities, they seemed to value other á

One of my good friends had to migrate to America.  Our friendship á
had developed quite well and it was a pity as our friendship would á
fade.

I remember my religious experience.  During  a gospel camp, a few á
friends of mine decided to believe in God.  The joy that I felt á
at that time was more than words can express.  I blessed them and á
praised God in my heart.

My friend and I had offended our classmate unintenionally.  We á
wanted to apologize to her so we decided to visit her.  We knew that she á
was stubborn so we were frightened.  When we rang her door bell, á
our fear was at it's climax

My girlfriend disliked it when I played majong (a game of gambling).  á
I expressed my regrets and when I went to see her she neglected my á
existance.  I was very angry and left in displeasure.

When I said good-bye to my girlfriend.  I had spent two years on á
developing this relationship and it was unsuccessful, I felt very á
sad.

I learnt from the newspaper that I had been accepted at the á
Chinese university of H.K.  It was 7 o'clock in the morning.  á
Later I told my family and relatives about it and had tea with á
them very joyfully.

I was camping in an old broken hut which had no lights.  I had á
brought along a lamp which was not working very well.  The door á
made strange sounds and I was sure that strange things were á
happening.  The most terrifying bit was that there were many á
wardrobes in the hut and everytime that I looked in the glass of á
the wardrobe I felt that there were "objects" behind me.   The á
whole night was spent in fear and restlessness.

During a football match, the other team was rude and they hurt my á
team members and me.  The coach was prejudiced against us and á
punished us unreasonably.  Later we fought with each other and á
the match had to be cut short.

I heard of the death of a closefriend of mine.  I had gone camping        á
with him shortly before his death and the whole thing seemed very  á
sudden to me.

After a busy day I went back to my hostel.  I closed the door and á
had a drink, then I read my favourite book on the bed.  Suddenly á
I felt peace and joy.

When I went home and there was nobody, I waited till 2 A.M and      á
still nobody.  I was suddenly scared and anxious as this had never á
happened before.  In addition my mother was very weak and I á
feared that she had met with an accident.  Therefore I was anxious  á
all night.

Yesterday I read in the newspaper that a 30 year old woman had á
abused her 2 month old son and had caused his death.  I was very á
angry after reading this as this is not a human act and to abuse á
so fragile a life is not a forgivable sin.

I had a schoolmate who went to the hospital as her brain was á
bleeding.  She fell unconscious for three days and when I went á
to see her I saw the miserable state the family was in.  Moreover á
I could not do nothing for her.  I was very sad.  Finally, she á
died.

I was appreciated by others, especially my family members and my á
friends.

Whenever I am alone in a dark room, walk alone on the street, á
sleep alone in the room at night or see something which is only á
partly visible.  This emotion was very strong when as an 8 year   á
old child I saw something horrible.

[ Whenever I put myself in other's shoes and try to make the á
person happy, comfort him or make friends and I am misunderstood á
and rejected, especially when this person is a family member or a friend.]

There was a conflict of interest between me and a close friend of á
mine.  He only thought about his own interest and not about our á
friendship.  This behaviour hurt his friends.  Another incident á
is when a friend isolated himself without giving any reasons.

When I received the letter informing that I had been accepted to á
be a Chinese university student, I was excited as I had longed á
for it.

One day when I was a little boy, my friends asked me to play á
with them outside and to catch some boys.  However our parents á
did not know that we were out and when I got home it was very á
late and I feared being scolded by my parents.

When I learnt that a friend of mine had talked about me to á
another friend and had said wrong things about my abilities and á
attitudes.  I was very angry.

About two years ago my girlfriend suggested that we separate.  á
This really gave me a shock as I had never thought that she would á
say such things.  The reason she gave me was that we were not á
suited for each other.

[ During a certain period, I felt successful and extremely satisfied.   á
When I found that any tasks or decisions that I had made were better  á
than expected.]
I am scared when I stroll alone on the Chung Chi college campus.

One day, I discussed a very important question with A.  A á
suddenly declared that he would not accept my position and á
thought that he himself was right.  Moreover, he attacked  á
strongly, not my opinion but me personally.

When I learnt that I had failed an exam,  This not only influenced á
my emotions but also other important tasks, it also made my á
record imperfect.

I felt happy when I received the letter telling me that I had á
been admitted to the university.

During the first year in university I had bad results in both á
the terms, especially the first term.  I was afraid that  I would á
not be promoted to the next year and that the others would go á
ahead of me.
Once my father slapped my mother for a small quarrel.

A few years ago my mother suffered from canccer and died within á
two years.  We had not finished our studies then and could not á
bear our responsibilities as her children.  My mother had tried á
her best to take care of us but she lived in pain these two á
years.  Neither the doctor nor we could do anything for her as á
cancer is incurable.  I was very eager to replace her in á
suffernig , even die instead of her.

One Saturday afternoon, I deliberately dressed up nicely (I had á
been in a bad mood of late).  I hoped to go for a walk in the á
soft sunlight to try and uplift my spirits.  When I was having á
lunch in the canteen, two of my male classmates asked me as to á
why I was dressed so nicely (they had seldom joked with me á
before).  One of them said that he had a lounge suit and we would á
look very nice if we wore them together.

The exam was drawing near and I wanted to prepare for it.  But I á
had a lot of other things to do so I did not have much time to prepare  á
for the exams.  Whenever I sat down to study I was scared that I would  á
not be able to finish it.

A female classmate was always late for meetings which were for á
the homework and not social gatherings.  We were very busy and á
the deadline was close but we had to waste half an hour or an á
hour waiting for her as we could do nothing else then.

After a meeting ended we started talking about when we would á
have the next discussion ( I had many tests the coming week and á
could not have a meeting in between, I thought that they would á
understand this as they had always done).  They did not á
understand my problem and thought that I should not have so many á
other activities.  Their reaction made me burst into tears.

It was the first time I met him (my boyfriend Mr.W).  It was á
during the first term Summer vacations.  We met each other while á
handing in our homework.  He invited me have a trip with him and á
we were together till 8 P.M.

The day the results of the certificate exam came out.  I went to á
school and at first I did not feel frightened.  By the time I á
reached the fourth floor ( the results were being given on the á
fifth floor) I found it difficult to walk and felt that I would á
die.

One day I had sunned my favourite shirt and was putting it back á
in the wardrobe when my younger brother snatched it from me and á
wore it.  He had not had a bath and was very dirty.  I scolded him á
but he answered back and locked himself up in a room.  I was very á
angry so I starteed kicking on the door and abusing him loudly á
and freely.

When I was a child I was playing on the upper deck of the bed á
with my brother.  My parents slept on the lower deck.  My father á
felt disgusted and beat me up.  I felt very sad as my father had á
never beaten me or scolded me before.

I had gone camping with my old classmates and there was a storm.  á
We were in a flurry but at that time I felt the love and concern á
of my friends.

I was on a trip to Phillipines during Summer and I was staying in á
a hotel.  The room I was staying in was very silent and had very á
dim lights.  The last night I felt frightened and lay awake - I á
could hear some sounds around me and dared not open my eyes - I á
waited for dawn.

I had a very good friend in secondary school.  The year after our á
graduation I prepared to celebrate her birthday and I called off á
all my appointments.  I got together the other friends and we á
were ready to give the entire day to her.  However this friend á
disappeared on her birthday.  When I phoned another friend I á
didcovered thay she was busy, I did not call her anymore.

I am a Christian but I cannot find any meaning in life . It á
seems that I am deceiving myself but I cannot find the way out.

When the result of the certificate exam was announced.  I was á
surprised and happy as the result was better than I had á
expected.

When I was young I got lost on the street and the police found me á
after a day.

My sister once stole my mother's money and made her very angry.  á
After this my mother would beat her up for unreasonable reasons.  á
One day my sister lent her book to a friend without telling my á
mother about it.  When my mother learnt this she beat her up and á
even threatened her with a pair of scissors.

My academic result was poor and I had to repeat the second year.  á
I felt sad about the coming several years.

I was admited to the Chinese university of Hong Kong.  The day á
the results were announced I looked in the newspaper and saw my á
candidature number.

One year, when I went to a camp, I was chased by a dog.  I tried á
hard and finally managed to escape from it.  My torch suddenly á
went off and we talked about ghost stories and I thought that á
there were ghosts.

When I was in F4 I played a basket-ball match against another á
school's team.  One of their team members kicked a team-mate of á
mine so I kicked him back and we had a fight with each other.

I received the mid-term exam paper of one of my major subjects á
and I found that I had failed it.
[ When my performance (homework or other work) is better than others.]

I found a problem in homework which would not get solved although á
I tried my best.

I had a date with my girlfriend, the time and place had not been á
fixed.  I asked her to phone me an hour later as it was midnight á
and I did not want to disturb her family.  I waited several hours á
for her call, she did not call me that night.

When I found that my ability to do ordinary work was worse than á
my fellow mates.

During my Summer vacations I planned a carnival for the community á
youth center with a few other volunteers.  I was the head of the á
organizors and we spent over a month planning it.  During this á
period we got to know and understood each other.  We á
discovered each others potential and we planned many interesting á
things for the carnival.  The day of the carnival everything was á
bright, the programmes went well and the attendants enjoyed it.  á
I felt extremely excited about it.
[ No response.]

I was a prefect at secondary school.  On the sports day I told á
others that I would take down the names of the people who á
misbehaved and after some time I sat down for a brief rest.  á
Suddenly the head prefect came and scolded me in front of others. á
 I was very angry as there were other prefects sitting and he á
picked on me.  I thought that a brief rest was not  serious á
enough to be blamed.
[ No response.]

When high level results were declared, I found my candidature á
number.  I was very happy as I had not expected it.  As I had been  á
injured before the examination and I had performed poorly.

Once, when I was ten, I could not remember why my mother was so á
angry.  She fainted suddenly and I was very scared as I did not á
know what to do .

When I got into a bus I found that my wallet had been stolen. á
It was not a great loss from the monetary point of view but I á
lost some documents - identity papers.  As a result I had to á
spend several days in order to get a new one.  I will always á
remember all the work I had to do and the bad treatment I á
suffered because of the bureaucratic behaviour of the civil á
servant.  I had already had bad luck and they treated me like a á
criminal.   At one point of time I really wanted to quarrel with á
them.

I quarrelled with my younger sister because I had said something á
against her boyfriend.  Consequently she looked through me when á
she saw me as she thought that I was trying to separate them.  á
She had misunderstood me.

After attending a song contest proposed by a band called "Chyne" á
we (6 of us) waited for the members of the band to greet us in á
front of the stage.  We went out after a few minutes as it was á
time to close the hall.  We had been waiting at the entrance hall á
for ten minutes when three of the band members came out.  They á
were very excited to see us, one of them was so excited that he á
had tears in his eyes.  We felt very warm and close to each á
other.  They took us back into the hall and we talked freely.  We á
were together for about an hour and during this time we felt á
that they were very sincere.

At noon one Sunday I received a phone call telling me that my á
mother had been knocked down by a car at the street crossing and á
that her husband should go and see her.  I could not believe this á
as my father and my mother had gone out together to buy lunch á
boxes.  However I immediately ran to the scene of the accident.

The day the results of the Chinese university was announced I á
should have been very happy; however my grandmother, because of  á
her prejudice and misunderstanding, started a  quarrel with my á
mother.  She expected me to take her side and she deliberately á
talked of my mother's wrong doings.  I was very angry because - á
one my grandmother was not being reasonable and two because it á
should have been a happy day and three we had moved into a new á
house that day.

When I was in lower six class during the Summer I joined a á
research group of the Chinese university student union.  I knew á
a lot of CV students there.  A year later one of them was á
travelling in mainland China and he got T.B.  He died a few weeks á
after coming back to H.K.  We all got together for the funeral á
and when I looked at the body for the last time I felt extremely á
sad.

When I received the result slip of the higher level examination á
(an university entrance exam) and saw that I had a very good á
possibility of being accepted into the university, I felt very á
excited.

One camping night, I listened to the ghost stories told by my á
classmates.

Last week I had planned to play tennis and had booked a tennis á
court.   However when I arrived at the university gym the clerk á
told me that the court was being used for lessons.

When I was ill and had to stay at the hospital for a period of á
time.

I had a dream : I had a very close friend who had several stone á
houses in the New Territories (villages) but they did not have á
much furniture.  He took me to see his fields (I had never seen á
them before) and there were several inches of clear water on á
which the sunshine was reflected.  I wanted to sit among the á
short green plants in the fields but was afraid of treading the á
plants to death.  My friend said "They will not die" and I sat á
down happily and my trousers did not get wet.

After seeing a horror film - Omen.  I could not sleep at night  á
even though I closed my eyes.  The last scene of the film kept á
coming back to me, I seemed to hear the girls in the film á
shouting at the devil.  The devil did not have any expression on á
his face and I thought that he would choose me.

My friend often played a joke on me and sometimes I thought that á
he was a nonsensical person. Once when we went to a friend's á
house he walked in first and shut the door firmly behind him.  I á
felt that he did not respect me and moreover I was his friend so á
he should not have behaved like that.  I was very angry (as it is á
I was in a bad mood then).

I suddenly found that those whom I considerered to be my good á
friends did not care for me.  Although I could still be with them á
I felt unimportant.  I deeply thought about the reason behind á
this so as to see who was responsible for this.  Finally I made á
up my mind and decided not to expect too much from them.  I was á
sad when I decided that they were no longer my good friends.

During the exam period I studied in the library alone.  A close   á
friend of mine, who is also a classmate, told me that my á
application for a Japanese inter-cultural exchange programme had á
been accepted.  I was not very sure as I did not know that the á
list had been declared.  I ran to the board and saw that I was á
really included in the list.  I was so excited that I smiled all á
day long.  When I met my classmates and friends I told them the á
good news.  I was so happy that I could not concentrate on my á
studies. á

A boy phoned me at night and wanted to talk to me for 30 minutes á
outside.  I thought that he would reveal what he felt and would á
question me on our relationship.  I treated him as a friend and á
did not want any misunderstandings.  Therefore I refused to meet á
him and told him that I would see him the coming day.  I was very á
unhappy as I feared having hurt him and got him into trouble.

We had fixed time for practice as we had to participate in the á
inter-department song contest.  I arrived and found that there á
was nobody there.  When I went to the canteen I found them eating á
lunch.  I was so angry that I aired my greviances to one of them á
and then left.

A friend told me that he had suffered in love and in academics.  á
I shared his sadness.

That afternoon I rushed home to look at the result slip of the á
higher level as fast as possible.  I opened the envelope very á
carefully and found that my results were much better than I á
had expected and thus I could enter the Chinese university.  My á
diligence had paid and I was very happy.

When I was young I had gone to an old lift and played with the á
antique lift.  The guy discovered me and warned me, I was very á
frightened.

Whenever my father smokes the smell makes me feel very á
uncomfortable.  He never listens to my complaints and I curse him á
furiously in my mind.  I cannot solve this problem by violence á
because of traditional moral values.

My got my mathematics test's marks and could not believe that it á
was true.  In the past I would have at least 80% marks.  Was I á
getting weaker at studies ?  This made me feel that I should not á
expect too much from going to the university.

One night, my boyfriend expressed his love for me in the canteen in á
the presence of my friends by giving me a present.

After listening to ghost stories with my classmates I had to back á
alone to the hostel at night.  I had to walk through a long and á
quiet road and I was scared of meeting a ghost.

I came across a girl at the school bus-stop, I had seen her á
several friends as she was a friend's friend.  However my friend á
had never introduced me to her and when she got off the bus I á
smiled at her but she did not respond pretending not to have seen á
me.  Her arrogant behaviour made me sick and angry.

My examination results were not satisfactory even though I had á
tried my best.  Then I started wondering about my abilities for á
the major subject.  However I did not know how to choose my major á
subject if I were to change it.

When two female classmates and I were having lunch, we chatted and  á
cracked jokes, I was very happy.  However, I felt that I may have  á
said something inappropriate which might cause them to have a bad  á
impression of me.

I did not do well in one of the subjects last term.   I was á
afraid that I would fail.  My result was a grade D, though it was á
not good I still passed.  I felt more comfortable then.

My friend half-teasingly called me a bad nickname.  I felt á
insulted and kicked his hip in anger.  I was stable later and did á
not feel angry at him.  In fact I was afraid that the other á
friends who were with us would think that I was an intolerant á
person.  However I could not apologize, so I pretended that á
nothing had happened and smiled when I left.  My friend did not á
say anything but just watched me leave.

Last night I did not do very well in one of the subjects.  Before á
the result was announced I feared that I would fail.  Finally I á
got a D and as the results of the other subjects were not all      á
good I felt a little sad.

When I received a letter from the university telling me that my á
application had been accepted.

At primary school the teacher caught me cheating during a á
dictation.
Someone spread rumours about me.

One night my father suddenly suffered from a heart attack which á
lead to breathing difficulties.
I had a picnic with old classmates, we chatted and played games.

At night when I was alone at home (all the family members usually á
get together at that time) someone knocked vigorously on the á
door.

When I saw that my bed at the hostel was a mess I guessed that á
someone else had used my daily necessities.  I felt that my  personal á
sanity had been affected.

During the Physics experiment session I did not understand the á
content of the experiment and did not know how to do it.

It was the first time that I gave a birthday present to my friend. á
  She wrote me a letter as she is my girlfriend.  The content of á
the letter was so sweet that it made me feel very happy.á

It was a week before the higher level results were announced.  I á
had tried and failed many times and this was the last time that á
I was taking the exam.  I knew that if i failed again I woulld á
have to enter the society.  I imagined things during this period á
- I dreamt that I had entered university and it was a nice á
experience.  When I thought about the future, an unexplainable á
fear rose in me.  I feared being a worker and not having a bright á
prospect, I also feared the criticism of my relatives as my á
brother had gone to university.  Whenevr I thought of this issue á
I could not eat or concentrate, and my heart beat increased.

The surname of my brother was different from ours.  He often á
grinned at home and provoked others for the pleasure of it.  This á
made me angry.

When I was in primary 6, my father died.  I was very young then á
and did not know what had happened.  The weeping of my relatives á
and my tears made me sad.

In August,1983, the long awaited "big envelope" (a document for á
C.U.H.K admission) arrived.  It was in the afternoon and I had á
not been doing anything.  When the postman, with his big bag, á
knocked on the door I knew what it was about.  I hurriedly á
opened the envelope and my mood at that time is hard to describe. á
 It lasted several hours and only calmed down later.

On Christmas eve,1984, I had just finished the exams and was á
afraid as the results of one of my major subjects had been very á
unsatisfactory.  I thought that I had only a 50% chance of á
passing.  Even if I failed this subject I would not need to á
repeat.  However I liked this subject very much and my results á
were bad because of my lazyness.  If I was forced to change to a á
minor in this subject I would be very unwilling.

In September 1984, I was forced to live with someone I did not á
like.  The first week we were at loggerheads and our conversation á
was like a debate.  The atmosphere was very bad.  When he learnt á
that I had got 95 marks in a test he told me " A failure, You lost á
5 marks."   I was very angry, not because my marks were lower á
than his, but because I could not tolerate his pride.  I did not á
show my discontentment and carried on doing my work.

This issue worried me rather than saddening me.  In mid September á
I went to Guanggho alone.  I was looking for an accomodation in á
the evening and after having walked 2 or 3 miles I still could not á
find anything.  What could I do?  I was not worried about á
sleeping on the streets but because of some procedural problems.  á
I finally found a place to sleep at 8 o'clock.
I received a letter from a distant friend.

My parents were out and I was the eldest at home.  At midnight a á
male stranger phoned us and spoke to me in a rough language.  I á
hung up and heard someone walking outside our door.

Two years back someone invited me to be the tutor of her á
grand-daughter.  The grand-daughter asked me some questions in á
mathematics so I taught her.  However she did not listen to me á
and this made me feel unhappy.  The second year it was the same.  á
When I entered university the girl's parents suggested that I be á
employed as their daghters tutor.  They told me that at university  á
there was no homework and I would have a lot of time so they á
made a time-table  for me which required me to be the tutor five á
days a week.  They did not respect me and anyway I had another á
child to teach.

I had taken the responsibility to do something and I had á
prepared for it.  However I failed because of my timidity.  After á
three attempts I still could not adapt to the atmosphere and á
failed as before.  I felt imcompetent and felt that the others á
would think that I had not prepared for it.
